newsitem.title: USA: Paxson to acquire ITT/Dow Jones TV station, launch network.
newsitem.headline: Paxson to acquire ITT/Dow Jones TV station, launch network.

text.p: Paxson Communications Corp. said Monday it agreed to acquire WBIS Channel 31 in New York City from a partnership of Dow Jones Inc. and ITT Corp. in a deal valued at $257.5 million.
Paxson said the channel, its 50th, will become the flagship station of the West Palm Beach, Fla.-based company's proposed new nationwide broadcast TV network.
The company said it is the largest U.S. TV station broadcaster, owning, operating or with affiliates covering more than 57 percent of all U.S. TV households.

In the run-up to the launch of the new network later this year, the station -- to be renamed WPXN TV-31 -- will sell air time to ethnic, foreign language, religious, cable and speciality programmers as well as infomercial entrepreneurs.

Paxson, which also owns 43 radio stations and 507 billboards throughout Florida, said it will operate the station under a time brokerage agreement from June 30 until the deal closes in the fourth quarter.
Dow Jones is expected to terminate its business news as of June 29.

But Paxson Chief Executive Lowell Paxson told reporters the station would continue to carry the 21 hours a week of sporting events and news provided by Liberty/Fox Sports -- a venture of News Corp. Ltd. and Liberty Media Corp.
In a joint statement, the sellers said they made a gain on their investment in the station, which they bought from the City of New York in 1996 for $207 million.
The deal is subject to regulatory approval, which is expected later this year. It is not subject to financing conditions, the companies said.
Paxson's stock fell 37.5 cents to $10 on the American Stock Exchange at midday.
